lead_paragraph: SISKIND--Diana, 85, a Manhattan psychoanalyst, author of three landmark books on child therapy, died Saturday, March 5, in her Upper West Side apartment. Born in Poland, her family spent four years fleeing the Holocaust before reaching New York City in 1941. She was fluent in five languages and graduated Syracuse in 1951. She received advanced degrees in Education, Social Work, and Psychotherapy. She was a nursery school teacher at City and Country, psychotherapist at Children's Day Treatment Center, senior staff member of the Child Development Center, before launching a private practice she had until September 2015. She was faculty of top social work programs including City College and Smith College. In 2007 she received the Lifetime Achievement Award from the American Association for Psychoanalysis in Clinical Social Work. She married Martin Benis, 1952 and had three children: John, Valerie, Tony. She divorced and remarried Elliott Siskind. In addition to her children she leaves nieces Lisa Steinberg and Ekaterine Eremenko. A service will be held Friday, March 11 at 1:00pm, Plaza Jewish Community Chapel, Amsterdam and 91st. 1/3
